accountNumber.description: Sets the account number for vendors to reference.
accountNumber.name: accountNumber

altName.description: This is the name of this person or company.
altName.name: altName

altPhone.description: Phone numbers can be entered in the following formats: 999-999-9999, 1-999-999-9999, (999) 999-9999, 1(999) 999-9999 or 999-999-9999 ext 9999
altPhone.name: altPhone

balance.description: This is a read-only calculated field that returns the vendor's current accounts payable balance. The balance field on the customer is only returned in search if you set the BodyFieldsOnly flag to false.
balance.name: balance

bcn.description: Enter the 15-digit registration number that identifies this vendor as a client of the Canada Customs and Revenue Agency (CCRA).
bcn.name: bcn

billPay.description: Check this box in order to send this vendor payments online.Before you can use this feature, you must set up Online Bill Pay at <_TABNAME=ADMI_XML_PAYTRUST_SETUP_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_XML_PAYTRUST_SETUP_> > Online Bill Pay.
billPay.name: billPay

category.externalId.description: References a value in a user defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > Vendor Categories.
category.externalId.name: category.externalId

category.internalId.description: References a value in a user defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > Vendor Categories.
category.internalId.name: category.internalId

category.name.description: References a value in a user defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > Vendor Categories.
category.name.name: category.name

comments.description: Enter any other information you wish to track for this vendor.
comments.name: comments

companyName.description: Required on Add when the isPerson field is set to FALSE.
companyName.name: companyName

creditLimit.description: A credit limit for your purchases from the vendor. If set, and depending on preferences, a warning is generated when this customer's limit is exceeded during a transaction addition.
creditLimit.name: creditLimit

currency.externalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Currencies. This value sets the currency that all transactions involving this vendor are conducted in. If defaults are OFF, this field is required. Can only be set if the multicurrency feature is enabled?
currency.externalId.name: currency.externalId

currency.internalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Currencies. This value sets the currency that all transactions involving this vendor are conducted in. If defaults are OFF, this field is required. Can only be set if the multicurrency feature is enabled?
currency.internalId.name: currency.internalId

currency.name.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Currencies. This value sets the currency that all transactions involving this vendor are conducted in. If defaults are OFF, this field is required. Can only be set if the multicurrency feature is enabled?
currency.name.name: currency.name

customForm.externalId.description: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
customForm.externalId.name: customForm.externalId

customForm.internalId.description: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
customForm.internalId.name: customForm.internalId

customForm.name.description: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
customForm.name.name: customForm.name

dateCreated.description: The date this record was created displays here.
dateCreated.name: dateCreated

defaultAddress.description: Read-only field that returns the default address for the vendor.
defaultAddress.name: defaultAddress

defaultTaxReg.externalId.description: Select the default tax registration number for this entity.
defaultTaxReg.externalId.displayName: Default Tax Reg. Number - External id
defaultTaxReg.externalId.name: defaultTaxReg.externalId

defaultTaxReg.internalId.description: Select the default tax registration number for this entity.
defaultTaxReg.internalId.displayName: Default Tax Reg. Number - Internal id
defaultTaxReg.internalId.name: defaultTaxReg.internalId

defaultTaxReg.name.description: Select the default tax registration number for this entity.
defaultTaxReg.name.name: defaultTaxReg.name

email.description: Sets the email address for the vendor. If giveAccess is also set to true this is the email used by the customer for login.
email.name: email

emailPreference.value.description: Reference to a value in a system list. Possible values include: _PDF, _HTML.
emailPreference.value.name: emailPreference.value

emailTransactions.description: Set a preferred transaction delivery method for this vendor. Choose to send transactions by regular mail, by email, by fax, or by a combination of the three. Then, when you select the vendor on a transaction, their preferred delivery method is marked by default.    * Email – Check this box to check the To Be Emailed box by default on transactions when this vendor is selected.    * Print – Check this box to check the To Be Printed box by default on transactions when this vendor is selected.    * Fax – Check this box to check the To Be Faxed box by default on transactions when this vendor is selected.Once you enter these settings on the vendor record, these boxes are checked by default for transactions created from the vendor record or for transactions that are copied or converted.Note: These settings override any customized settings on transaction forms you use.There are also preferences to set default values for new vendor records at <_TABNAME=ADMI_PRINTING_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_PRINTING_> > Printing, Fax and Email Preferences. On the Print subtab, Fax subtab, or Email subtab, check Vendors Default to [Print/Fax/Email] Transactions.You can also set these fields using the Mass Update function. Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_BULKOP_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_BULKOP_> > Mass Updates > General and click Vendor.
emailTransactions.name: emailTransactions

expenseAccount.externalId.description: References an existing account to be used for goods and services you purchase from this vendor.
expenseAccount.externalId.name: expenseAccount.externalId

expenseAccount.internalId.description: References an existing account to be used for goods and services you purchase from this vendor.
expenseAccount.internalId.name: expenseAccount.internalId

expenseAccount.name.description: References an existing account to be used for goods and services you purchase from this vendor.
expenseAccount.name.name: expenseAccount.name

fax.description: Sets the fax number for the vendor.
fax.name: fax

faxTransactions.description: Set a preferred transaction delivery method for this vendor. Choose to send transactions by regular mail, by email, by fax, or by a combination of the three. Then, when you select the vendor on a transaction, their preferred delivery method is marked by default.    * Email – Check this box to check the To Be Emailed box by default on transactions when this vendor is selected.    * Print – Check this box to check the To Be Printed box by default on transactions when this vendor is selected.    * Fax – Check this box to check the To Be Faxed box by default on transactions when this vendor is selected.Once you enter these settings on the vendor record, these boxes are checked by default for transactions created from the vendor record or for transactions that are copied or converted.Note: These settings override any customized settings on transaction forms you use.There are also preferences to set default values for new vendor records at <_TABNAME=ADMI_PRINTING_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_PRINTING_> > Printing, Fax and Email Preferences. On the Print subtab, Fax subtab, or Email subtab, check Vendors Default to [Print/Fax/Email] Transactions.You can also set these fields using the Mass Update function. Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_BULKOP_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_BULKOP_> > Mass Updates > General and click Vendor.
faxTransactions.name: faxTransactions

firstName.description: Required on Add when the isPerson field is set to TRUE.
firstName.name: firstName

giveAccess.description: Enables access to your NetSuite account for the vendor. The level of access is defined by the role assigned in the accessRole field.
giveAccess.name: giveAccess

globalSubscriptionStatus.value.description: Email recipients can have one of four subscription statuses:    * Confirmed Opt-In - When an email recipient has indicated that they want to receive your campaign messages, they are assigned this subscription status. Only a recipient can set his or her subscription status to Confirmed Opt-In.    * Soft Opt-In - Recipients with this status can receive opt-in messages that enable them to confirm whether or not they want to receive your email campaigns as well as email marketing campaigns.      You can set a recipient’s status to Soft Opt-In manually or through a mass update.    * Soft Opt-Out - Recipients with this status cannot receive campaign email messages but can receive opt-in messages.      You can change this subscription status to Soft Opt-In manually or through a mass update.    * Confirmed Opt-Out - Only the recipient can set their subscription status to Confirmed Opt-Out.      Recipients with this status cannot receive email campaigns or opt-in messages. Recipients with this status can only opt in again through the Vendor Center or by clicking the link in a campaign message they have received prior to opting out.
globalSubscriptionStatus.value.name: globalSubscriptionStatus.value

image.externalId.description: References an image file that has already been uploaded to the account.
image.externalId.name: image.externalId

image.internalId.description: References an image file that has already been uploaded to the account.
image.internalId.name: image.internalId

image.name.description: References an image file that has already been uploaded to the account.
image.name.name: image.name

incoterm.externalId.description: Choose the standardized three-letter trade term to be used on transactions related to this vendor.These terms are international commercial procurement practices that communicate the tasks, costs, and risks associated with the transportation and delivery of goods. Incoterms define where the customer takes ownership of the product and are typically used for international orders, such as when an item goes through customs or crosses a border.
incoterm.externalId.name: incoterm.externalId

incoterm.internalId.description: Choose the standardized three-letter trade term to be used on transactions related to this vendor.These terms are international commercial procurement practices that communicate the tasks, costs, and risks associated with the transportation and delivery of goods. Incoterms define where the customer takes ownership of the product and are typically used for international orders, such as when an item goes through customs or crosses a border.
incoterm.internalId.name: incoterm.internalId

incoterm.name.description: Choose the standardized three-letter trade term to be used on transactions related to this vendor.These terms are international commercial procurement practices that communicate the tasks, costs, and risks associated with the transportation and delivery of goods. Incoterms define where the customer takes ownership of the product and are typically used for international orders, such as when an item goes through customs or crosses a border.
incoterm.name.name: incoterm.name

is1099Eligible.description: If set to TRUE, this vendor is 1099 eligible.Note: Only vendors that use the U.S. dollar are 1099 eligible.
is1099Eligible.name: is1099Eligible

isAccountant.description: If set to TRUE, this vendor has free access to the NetSuite account and the isAccountant field is set to FALSE for any vendor record previously defined as the Free Accountant.
isAccountant.name: isAccountant

isInactive.description: This field is false by default.
isInactive.name: isInactive

isJobResourceVend.description: Sets this vendor as a resource on tasks and jobs.
isJobResourceVend.name: isJobResourceVend

isPerson.description: By default, this is set to True which specifies the type of vendor record as Individual. If set to False, the vendor record is set as a Company type.
isPerson.name: isPerson

laborCost.description: Enter the cost of labor for this vendor in order to be able to calculate profitability on jobs.
laborCost.name: laborCost

lastName.description: Optionally enter a last name here.
lastName.name: lastName

legalName.description: Enter the legal name for this vendor for financial purposes.If you entered a name in the Company Name field, that name appears here.
legalName.name: legalName

openingBalance.description: Enter the opening balance of your account with this vendor.
openingBalance.name: openingBalance

openingBalanceAccount.externalId.description: Select the account this opening balance is applied to.

openingBalanceDate.description: Enter the date of the balance entered in the Opening Balance field
openingBalanceDate.name: openingBalanceDate

password.description: Sets the password assigned to allow this vendor access to NetSuite.
password.name: password

printOnCheckAs.description: Sets the Pay to the Order of line of a check instead of what you entered in the Vendor field.

printTransactions.description: Set a preferred transaction delivery method for this vendor. Choose to send transactions by regular mail, by email, by fax, or by a combination of the three. Then, when you select the vendor on a transaction, their preferred delivery method is marked by default.    * Email – Check this box to check the To Be Emailed box by default on transactions when this vendor is selected.    * Print – Check this box to check the To Be Printed box by default on transactions when this vendor is selected.    * Fax – Check this box to check the To Be Faxed box by default on transactions when this vendor is selected.Once you enter these settings on the vendor record, these boxes are checked by default for transactions created from the vendor record or for transactions that are copied or converted.Note: These settings override any customized settings on transaction forms you use.There are also preferences to set default values for new vendor records at <_TABNAME=ADMI_PRINTING_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_PRINTING_> > Printing, Fax and Email Preferences. purchaseOrderAmount.description: Enter the tolerance limit for the discrepancy between the amount on the vendor bill and purchase order.

purchaseOrderQuantityDiff.description: Enter the difference limit for the discrepancy between the quantity on the vendor bill and purchase order.

representingSubsidiary.externalId.description: Indicates that this entity is an intercompany vendor. Select the subsidiary this vendor represents as the seller in intercompany transactions.
representingSubsidiary.externalId.name: representingSubsidiary.externalId

requirePwdChange.description: If set to TRUE, the vendor is required to change the default password assign on the next login attempt.

requirePwdChange.name: requirePwdChange

sendEmail.description: This field can only be set on ADD. When set to TRUE, an email notification is sent to the Vendor to inform them that they have been granted access to your account.
sendEmail.name: sendEmail

subsidiary.externalId.description: Select the subsidiary to associate with this vendor. If you use NetSuite OneWorld, select the primary subsidiary to assign to this vendor.You cannot enter transactions for this vendor unless a subsidiary, or primary subsidiary is assigned.The default primary currency for the vendor is the base currency of the primary subsidiary.If you select this vendor on a transaction, the transaction is associated with this subsidiary. The vendor is able to access only information associated with this subsidiary. Note: After a transaction has posted for the vendor, you are not able to change the subsidiary selected on the vendor record. If you have NetSuite OneWorld, after you save the vendor record, you cannot change the primary subsidiary.
subsidiary.externalId.name: subsidiary.externalId

subsidiary.internalId.description: Select the subsidiary to associate with this vendor. If you use NetSuite OneWorld, select the primary subsidiary to assign to this vendor.You cannot enter transactions for this vendor unless a subsidiary, or primary subsidiary is assigned.The default primary currency for the vendor is the base currency of the primary subsidiary.If you select this vendor on a transaction, the transaction is associated with this subsidiary. The vendor is able to access only information associated with this subsidiary. Note: After a transaction has posted for the vendor, you are not able to change the subsidiary selected on the vendor record. If you have NetSuite OneWorld, after you save the vendor record, you cannot change the primary subsidiary.
subsidiary.internalId.name: subsidiary.internalId

subsidiary.name.description: Select the subsidiary to associate with this vendor. If you use NetSuite OneWorld, select the primary subsidiary to assign to this vendor.You cannot enter transactions for this vendor unless a subsidiary, or primary subsidiary is assigned.The default primary currency for the vendor is the base currency of the primary subsidiary.If you select this vendor on a transaction, the transaction is associated with this subsidiary. The vendor is able to access only information associated with this subsidiary. Note: After a transaction has posted for the vendor, you are not able to change the subsidiary selected on the vendor record. If you have NetSuite OneWorld, after you save the vendor record, you cannot change the primary subsidiary.
subsidiary.name.name: subsidiary.name

If you have enabled the preference Vendor Credit Limit Includes Orders, then this total is included in credit limit calculations.
